name: libxcb

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
The X protocol C-language Binding (XCB) is a replacement for Xlib
featuring a small footprint, latency hiding, direct access to the
protocol, improved threading support, and extensibility.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: libpthread-stubs
dependencies.description:
The libpthread-stubs package provides weak aliases for pthread functions
not provided in libc or otherwise available by default.

dependencies.name: libxau
dependencies.description:
The libXau package contains a library implementing the X11 Authorization
Protocol. This is useful for restricting client access to the display.

dependencies.name: libxdmcp
dependencies.description: libXdmcp - X Display Manager Control Protocol library.

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkg-config is a helper tool used when compiling applications and
libraries

dependencies.name: util-macros
dependencies.description:
This is a set of autoconf macros used by the configure.ac scripts in
other Xorg modular packages, and is needed to generate new versions of
their configure scripts with autoconf.

dependencies.name: xcb-proto
dependencies.description:
xcb-proto provides the XML-XCB protocol descriptions that libxcb uses to
generate the majority of its code and API.

dependent_to.name: coin3d
dependent_to.description:
Coin is an OpenGL-based, 3D graphics library that has its roots in the
Open Inventor 2.1 API, which Coin still is compatible with.

dependent_to.name: startup-notification
dependent_to.description:
startup-notification contains a reference implementation of the
freedesktop startup notification protocol.

dependent_to.name: astra
dependent_to.description: A Space Charge Tracking Algorithm.

dependent_to.name: libx11
dependent_to.description: libX11 - Core X11 protocol client library.

dependent_to.name: perl-tk
dependent_to.description: Interface to Tk Graphics Library

dependent_to.name: xcb-util-xrm
dependent_to.description:
XCB util-xrm module provides the 'xrm' library, i.e. utility functions
for the X resource manager.

dependent_to.name: xcb-util-keysyms
dependent_to.description:
The XCB util modules provides a number of libraries which sit on top of
libxcb, the core X protocol library, and some of the extension
libraries. These experimental libraries provide convenience functions
and interfaces which make the raw X protocol more usable. Some of the
libraries also provide client-side code which is not strictly part of
the X protocol but which have traditionally been provided by Xlib.

dependent_to.name: xlsatoms
dependent_to.description: xlsatoms lists the interned atoms defined on an X11 server.

dependent_to.name: compiz
dependent_to.description:
compiz - OpenGL window and compositing manager. Compiz is an OpenGL
compositing manager that use GLX_EXT_texture_from_pixmap for binding
redirected top-level windows to texture objects. It has a flexible plug-
in system and it is designed to run well on most graphics hardware.

dependent_to.name: py-xpyb
dependent_to.description:
xpyb provides a Python binding to the X Window System protocol via
libxcb.

dependent_to.name: xwininfo
dependent_to.description:
xwininfo prints information about windows on an X server. Various
information is displayed depending on which options are selected.

dependent_to.name: qt
dependent_to.description: Qt is a comprehensive cross-platform C++ application framework.

dependent_to.name: libxkbcommon
dependent_to.description:
xkbcommon is a library to handle keyboard descriptions, including
loading them from disk, parsing them and handling their state. It's
mainly meant for client toolkits, window systems, and other system
applications.

dependent_to.name: xdpyinfo
dependent_to.description:
xdpyinfo is a utility for displaying information about an X server. It
is used to examine the capabilities of a server, the predefined values
for various parameters used in communicating between clients and the
server, and the different types of screens, visuals, and X11 protocol
extensions that are available.

dependent_to.name: py-pillow
dependent_to.description:
Pillow is a fork of the Python Imaging Library (PIL). It adds image
processing capabilities to your Python interpreter. This library
supports many file formats, and provides powerful image processing and
graphics capabilities.

dependent_to.name: pulseaudio
dependent_to.description:
PulseAudio is a sound system for POSIX OSes, meaning that it is a proxy
for your sound applications. PulseAudio is a sound system for POSIX
OSes, meaning that it is a proxy for your sound applications. It allows
you to do advanced operations on your sound data as it passes between
your application and your hardware. Things like transferring the audio
to a different machine, changing the sample format or channel count and
mixing several sounds into one are easily achieved using a sound server.

dependent_to.name: xcb-util-image
dependent_to.description:
The XCB util modules provides a number of libraries which sit on top of
libxcb, the core X protocol library, and some of the extension
libraries. These experimental libraries provide convenience functions
and interfaces which make the raw X protocol more usable. Some of the
libraries also provide client-side code which is not strictly part of
the X protocol but which have traditionally been provided by Xlib.

dependent_to.name: xlsclients
dependent_to.description:
xlsclients is a utility for listing information about the client
applications running on a X11 server.

dependent_to.name: xcb-util-cursor
dependent_to.description:
The XCB util modules provides a number of libraries which sit on top of
libxcb, the core X protocol library, and some of the extension
libraries. These experimental libraries provide convenience functions
and interfaces which make the raw X protocol more usable. Some of the
libraries also provide client-side code which is not strictly part of
the X protocol but which have traditionally been provided by Xlib.

dependent_to.name: cairo
dependent_to.description: Cairo is a 2D graphics library with support for multiple output devices.

dependent_to.name: xcb-util
dependent_to.description:
The XCB util modules provides a number of libraries which sit on top of
libxcb, the core X protocol library, and some of the extension
libraries. These experimental libraries provide convenience functions
and interfaces which make the raw X protocol more usable. Some of the
libraries also provide client-side code which is not strictly part of
the X protocol but which have traditionally been provided by Xlib.

dependent_to.name: xcb-util-errors
dependent_to.description:
The XCB util modules provides a number of libraries which sit on top of
libxcb, the core X protocol library, and some of the extension
libraries. These experimental libraries provide convenience functions
and interfaces which make the raw X protocol more usable. Some of the
libraries also provide client-side code which is not strictly part of
the X protocol but which have traditionally been provided by Xlib.

dependent_to.name: vapor
dependent_to.description:
VAPOR is the Visualization and Analysis Platform for Ocean, Atmosphere,
and Solar Researchers. VAPOR provides an interactive 3D visualization
environment that can also produce animations and still frame images.

dependent_to.name: sublime-text
dependent_to.description: Sublime Text is a sophisticated text editor for code, markup and prose.

dependent_to.name: mesa
dependent_to.description:
Mesa is an open-source implementation of the OpenGL specification - a
system for rendering interactive 3D graphics.

dependent_to.name: qt-base
dependent_to.description: Qt Base (Core, Gui, Widgets, Network, ...)

dependent_to.name: xcb-util-renderutil
dependent_to.description:
The XCB util modules provides a number of libraries which sit on top of
libxcb, the core X protocol library, and some of the extension
libraries. These experimental libraries provide convenience functions
and interfaces which make the raw X protocol more usable. Some of the
libraries also provide client-side code which is not strictly part of
the X protocol but which have traditionally been provided by Xlib.

dependent_to.name: xbacklight
dependent_to.description:
Xbacklight is used to adjust the backlight brightness where supported.
It uses the RandR extension to find all outputs on the X server
supporting backlight brightness control and changes them all in the same
way.

dependent_to.name: xcb-demo
dependent_to.description: xcb-demo: A collection of demo programs that use the XCB library.

dependent_to.name: libcanberra
dependent_to.description:
libcanberra is an implementation of the XDG Sound Theme and Name
Specifications, for generating event sounds on free desktops, such as
GNOME.

dependent_to.name: xeyes
dependent_to.description: xeyes - a follow the mouse X demo, using the X SHAPE extension

dependent_to.name: xcb-util-wm
dependent_to.description:
The XCB util modules provides a number of libraries which sit on top of
libxcb, the core X protocol library, and some of the extension
libraries. These experimental libraries provide convenience functions
and interfaces which make the raw X protocol more usable. Some of the
libraries also provide client-side code which is not strictly part of
the X protocol but which have traditionally been provided by Xlib.

dependent_to.name: py-pillow-simd
dependent_to.description:
Pillow-SIMD is a SIMD-enabled fork of Pillow. It is usually 4-6x faster
than the original Pillow in image processing benchmarks.

dependent_to.name: xterm
dependent_to.description:
The xterm program is a terminal emulator for the X Window System. It
provides DEC VT102 and Tektronix 4014 compatible terminals for programs
that can't use the window system directly.

dependent_to.name: gmic
dependent_to.description:
G'MIC is an open-source framework for digital image processing. G'MIC is
a full-featured open-source framework for digital image processing,
distributed under the CeCILL free software licenses (LGPL-like and/or
GPL-compatible). It provides several user interfaces to convert /
process / visualize generic image datasets, ranging from 1D scalar
signals to 3D+t sequences of multi-spectral volumetric images, hence
including 2D color images.
